fields.description:
h3. Issue Summary

When making any changes to the original *To Do* status or column, this will cause the status to become "no category" and any Issue in this status will be in that state, resulting in various types of inconsistent behaviors in Jira for anything status related (eg. *Issues in no category* tab in the *Releases*)

h3. Steps to Reproduce
This can be reproduced in 2 ways:
 # Move the first original *To Do* column to another position on the Board
 # Move that *To Do* column back to the first position OR put another status as the first column

The above will cause the *To Do* status or any other status moved to the first column to forever be without a status category.

# Go to Project settings > Issue types > *Edit workflow*
# Add a new status in the *To Do* category and save

The above will cause the new status to be a "no category" status.

h3. Expected Results

Whether you're adding a *To Do* status from the Workflow or moving columns, the first position column should always retain the *To Do* category.

h3. Actual Results

It loses its category and remains with no category. You can see this as the status icon becomes a very faint color.

 !Untitled___100_0__.png|thumbnail! 

h3. Workaround

Currently, there is no known workaround for this behavior. Please contact [Atlassian Support|https://support.atlassian.com/contact] for further assistance.
fields.summary: Board columns can't handle changes to the To Do status category

fields.description:
h3. Issue Summary

Upon adding time via the "Time tracking" field of an issue from the issue detail view on the board, the "Remaining estimate" field is not updated on the board until the page is refreshed.
h3. Steps to Reproduce
 1. Create a Jira Scrum project
 2. From the board settings, configure the "Estimation statistic" as "Original Time Estimate" and set the time tracking as "Remaining Estimate and Time Spent"

!Screenshot 2020-11-19 at 1.05.01 PM.png|width=350,height=216!
 3. Create an issue in the project backlog and set the Original estimate (Example: 1h)
 4. Create a sprint with the above created issue and start the sprint. 
 5. Open the issue in detail view and add time via the "Time Tracking" field.
 6. We see that the remaining estimate updates in the issue view. However, the remaining estimate does not get updated in the board until the page is refreshed.

h3. Expected Results
The "Remaining Estimate" field should be updated on the scrum board once time is logged on the issue.

h3. Actual Results
The "Remaining Estimate" field is not updated on the scrum board.

h3. Workaround
Refresh the page to see updated value of "Remaining Estimate" on the scrum board.
fields.summary: Remaining Estimate field is not updated on the scrum board when the time tracking is populated via the issue detail view

fields.description:
h3. Issue Summary

When creating a subtask under an issue with team assigned, the subtask does not get the same team as the parent.
h3. Steps to Reproduce
 # Create a plan
 # Create a story
 # Select a team for the story
 # Commit it to Jira
 # Create a subtask under the newly created story
 # Commit the subtask

h3. Expected Results

The subtask should have the team of the parent story in the Advanced Roadmaps plan view
h3. Actual Results

The subtask does not have a team assigned to it in the Advanced Roadmaps plan view
h3. Workaround

N/A
fields.summary: Creating a subtask under a parent with team is not getting the team assigned to it in Advanced Roadmaps plan view

fields.description:
Hello - 

Please separate the ticket activity and comments from the customer portal view. 

 

Tickets are way too crowded with activity and comments in 1 view.
fields.summary: separate ticket activity with comments in JSD Customer view portal

fields.description:
Updating Target Start/End dates in Advanced Roadmaps does not generate Issue Update history in Jira.
Without the history being generated, as a user, it is hard to track edits in Issue fields that were performed in Advanced Roadmaps and which user triggered the issue field update.
fields.summary: Updating Target Start/End dates in Advanced Roadmaps does not generate Issue Update history in Jira

fields.description:
For the time being, the alert boxes/notifications aren't configurable. It would be awesome to have the ability to control it and to manage where it should be displayed because sometimes it's displayed and overlaps other features.

 !notificationExample.png|thumbnail!
fields.summary: Option to configure where the alerts are displayed

fields.description:
h3. Issue Summary
When we access the board settings and try to go back to the board using the hyperlink, it's not working.

h3. Steps to Reproduce
 # Access any classic software project
 # Go to the *Board Settings*
 # Click on the hyperlink containing the name of the board 

See below a video showing it:
* [^bugBoard.MP4] 

h3. Expected Results
It should redirect to the board page again.

h3. Actual Results
Nothing happens.

h3. Workaround
 Currently, there is no known workaround for this behavior. A workaround will be added here when available.
fields.summary: Hyperlink to go back to the board is not working

fields.description:
At the moment, deleting a sprint is based on the "Manage Sprint" permission.
Since this is a deletion process, it would be nice to have a separate permission for this action.
fields.summary: As a JIRA administrator, I would like to be able to specify who is allowed to delete sprints

fields.description:
When accessing a Kanban or a Scrum board, you can click on users' avatar to apply an Assignee Filter and displaying only cards assigned to that user. 
 !image-2020-11-17-10-00-21-221.png|thumbnail! 

As a Board Admin, I'd like to customize the number of avatars that will appear there, to reduce or increase that number which currently it's only 6 users. 

You can click on *+"number"* to display a drop-down menu to show all the users but it would be nice to have this customization.
fields.summary: As a Board Admin, I'd like to customize the number of users appearing on the Assignee Filter on a SW board

fields.description: At the moment, the quick filters displayed on the board will follow the order of creation in Board settings >  Quick filters. Provide a way to sort the quick filters.
fields.summary: Ability to sort quick filters

fields.description:
h3. Issue Summary
Quick Filter action not working after navigating to a Dashboard and coming back to the Project board using the Search bar recent option
h3. Steps to Reproduce
Test 1:
 1) Navigate to a Project Board
 2) Select any of the existing QF
 3) Navigate to a Dashboard
 4) Then navigate back to the previous project board by clicking the search bar and selecting the board under recent project boards

h3. Expected Results
The project board has the *Quick filter* selected and the correct issues listed
h3. Actual Results
The *Quick filter* will be shown as highlighted however the issue records do not coincide with it:

[^JRACLOUD-75575.webm]
h3. Workaround

You will need to fully refresh the web browser so it can trigger the quick filter selected
fields.summary: Quick Filter action not working after navigating to a Dashboard and coming back

fields.description:
For overall Sprint Planning it would be very helpful if the information about an assignee's capacity would be available not only in Portfolio but also directly in the Project - f.e. in the Backlog where the workload per assignee for the current sprint can be viewed.

This would increase the simplicity on planning Sprints. 

Thanks,
Irina
fields.summary: Include capacity into Backlog

fields.description:
As Stories and other issues can have several sub-tasks underneath the story can only be closed once all sub-tasks are closed. That results in a large gap at the beginning of each Burndown Chart. This also means that this report doesn't give an accurate representation of what work is actually getting done.

Therefore, it would be great if there would be a possbility to choose on which level (Story or Sub-Task) the Burndown Chart is being created or to generally integrate Sub-Tasks into the Burndown Chart.

Thanks,
Irina
fields.summary: View Sub-Tasks in the Burndown Chart

fields.description:
In the NextGen Kanban board, there is an option to Clear the Done issues available on the top of the Done Column. In case the user accidentally clears the issues, there is no direct option to revert this activity. One workaround is to change the status of the issue and drag it to the last column. However, this can be an issue if there are a very high number of issues to be reverted.

*Workaround*

1) Use Bulk update option or Automation to transition the issues to old status.
 2) Drag the issue across the board to the last column.
fields.summary: Ability to revert "Clear Done issue" in NextGen Kanban board.

fields.description:
*Summary*
At the moment, sysadmins/admins cannot identify the plan creator/owner. It would be desirable that admins have this information to reach out to plan owners when required.

*Use case*
Require a way to identify all plan owners of Advanced Roadmaps in Jira. This is because we wish to send them some comms about the use of Advanced Roadmaps within our environment
fields.summary: Allow sysadmin/admin to identify the plan creator/owner

fields.description:
h3. Issue Summary

Due to invalid date format error in Japanese, a sprint cannot be started.
h3. Steps to Reproduce
 # Set the UI language to Japanese

 # Access a backlog

 # Select End Date from the date picker

 # Click "Start(開始)"

h3. Expected Results

Should be able to start sprint
h3. Actual Results

See screenshot attached
h3. Workaround

Switch language to English and start the sprint
fields.summary: Cannot start a sprint due to invalid date format error in Japanese

fields.description:
Currently, Jira Software board cards don't show different issue link types than "depends on". 
It would be nice to have all the link types available for display.
fields.summary: Allow board cards to display all issue link types

fields.description:
When there is an issue with a value for a custom field (select list - multiple choice) and we move this issue from a company-managed (formerly classic) project to a team-managed (formerly next-gen), the value of the custom field is retained when using the advanced issue search.

It would be awesome to have an option to disable this option and clear that value after moving the issue because it could mislead a report that is using company-managed (formerly classic) and team-managed (formerly next-gen) projects.
fields.summary: Option to retain a value when moving an issue from a company-managed project to team-managed

fields.description: I would want Business Value field should come as by default in Jira Tool and shall not be dependent on Jira Admin for the customization. As HCL, we serve more than 100+ customers and work with them on Jira Tool for project tracking. Capturing business value is one of the Agile principles and to make customer or client understand to include Business Value in Jira Tool is very long convincing process. Hence, if a patch can be released to all Jira users and update it, so that Business Value can come as default in the tool. Hope this clarifies the requirement.
fields.summary: Business Value field to come as by default. Dependency on Jira Admin to customize and add field needs to be removed

fields.description:
Please make the Project field 500px wide. We have project names which can not fit in 250px, so more than half the time I can not tell which projects are available or which project I am creating the issue in.

Thanks,

Ivan

!image-2020-11-13-11-20-14-337.png!
fields.summary: Please make project field 500px wide

fields.description:
At the moment, if there are boards created for a specific project then there is no way to delete these boards within the project and the user has to manually access https://<site-name>/jira/boards to delete the boards.

If there are multiple boards across projects, boards drop-down shows *VIEW ALL* which redirects to the global page for boards.
fields.summary: Ability to delete boards within the project

fields.description:
Please, include the possibility to hide the assignee quick filters (Buttons) from the board view:

!Screen Shot 2020-11-12 at 16.05.27.png|width=547,height=124!
fields.summary: Ability to hide the assignee quick filters from the board view

fields.description:
h3. Issue Summary
When you use a screenshot tool that lets you store it in the clipboard and then pasting it with command + v into a pop-up issue view it is added automatically but also an attachment screen appears asking for upload if you click on upload the picture is attached twice.

h3. Steps to Reproduce
 # Create a screenshot storing it in the clipboard
 # Open an issue in the pop-up view e.g. clicking it in a board
 # In the pop-up view use command + v to paste it
 # See an example below, I used monosnap as the screenshot tool
https://share.getcloudapp.com/6quPyROl

h3. Expected Results
The attachment should be added. until the upload button is clicked

h3. Actual Results
The attachment is added in the background and also when you click on the upload button

h3. Workaround
Click the CANCEL button instead of the UPLOAD button
fields.summary: Screenshots attaching twice when pasting from the clipboard using command + v in the pop-up issue view

fields.description:
It would be really great if new "Issue View" allows us to highlight some text inside code formatted snippet during edition of description. Code formatting and syntax highlighting is pretty cool! But we often wish to highlight someway (change color/change boldness etc.) some property to emphasize it. Now "Bold/Italic buttons" and "Color button" are disabled during editing code formatted text:

!image-2020-11-12-20-13-45-753.png!

We can only clear formatting and then change color/boldness of text. And we loose pretty cool code formatting in this case:

!image-2020-11-12-20-16-24-368.png!
fields.summary: Ability to change color of text inside syntax highlighted/code formatted block

fields.description:
For now, we offer a Removed Issues section under the Plan settings will list all removed issues from the Plan for admins.
It would be nice if admins could do a clean up on this list, based on the 5k limitation we current have there.
fields.summary: Create a 'clean up' button for large removed issue backlog under Removed Issues Section

fields.description:
h3. Issue Summary

If a board has non-working days configured in it and a sprint is started from said board, if you select a pre-defined duration, say 2 weeks, the default end date doesn't take non-working days into consideration. Also, in the end date selection field the calendar doesn't show any indications of the days that have been configured as non-working days.

h3. Steps to Reproduce
# Configure a board to have non-working days
# From the board's backlog create a sprint and go to the *Start* dialog
# Select a duration for the sprint that includes the configured non-working day.
# Open the calendar for the end date field.

h3. Expected Results

It is expected that the sprint creation dialog takes into consideration non-working days and compensates for them.

h3. Actual Results

There's no indication, warning or automatic compensation in the end date field for non-working days.

h3. Workaround

The end date can be manually configured to compensate for non-working days; however this requires an extra step of manually verifying the board settings every time a sprint is going to be started.
fields.summary: Planning a sprint on a board with non-working days configured doesn't compensate for those days

fields.description:
Atlassian teams continually monitor performance, looking at the time it takes to load the board for the first time and subsequent times.
 * *First time:* We call this "*Initial Load*", and it includes resources for all the views plus assets like images, so it is usually longer.
 * *Subsequent times:* We call this "*Transitions*", such as loading a board a 2nd time *through clicking on the project side navigation* after transitioning from the backlog (e.g. board -> backlog -> board), which is faster because most assets are already loaded.

 

To improve performance for *boards with 300-500 cards*, we are aiming for several milestones as part of a longer journey:

*Today:*
 * *Initial Loads:* 90% of board loads within 12s, and 99% within 34s

 * *Transitions:* 90% of board loads within 6s, and 99% within 13s

*Milestone 1: (/) Achieved as of July 2021*
 * *Initial Loads:* 90% of board loads within 10s (/) *(currently 7.6s)*, and 99% within 27s (/) *(currently 25s)*

 * *Transitions:* 90% of board loads within 4s (/) *(currently 4s)*, and 99% within 11s (/) *(currently 10.7s)*

*Milestone 2:*
 * *Initial Loads:* 90% of board loads within 7s, and 99% within 14s

 * *Transitions**:* 90% of board loads within 2s, and 99% within 7s

*Milestone 3:*
 * *Initial Loads:* 90% of board loads within 4s, and 99% within 10s

 * *Transitions**:* 90% of board loads within 1s, and 99% within 3s

We’ll update this issue with progress towards these milestones, and will do it at least every quarter. We have a public commitment to improve the performance of all key experiences within Jira (e.g. issues, search, filters, boards, and backlogs) as shown in our [public roadmap|https://www.atlassian.com/roadmap/cloud?category=performanceReliability].

 

*What about boards with more than 500 cards?*

We do not recommend having >500 cards on your boards. The board should ideally represent the highest priority for your team in the coming few weeks, and not contain all the issues in the project. This [community post|https://community.atlassian.com/t5/Next-gen-articles/Setting-up-next-gen-boards-and-backlogs-for-optimal-performance/ba-p/1530871] explains how to optimize your board to show < 500 cards.
fields.summary: Make Next-gen boards with hundreds of cards snappier

fields.description: Every time I view the roadmap I have to apply the right filters to get the view I want, which is to say I do not want to see completed epics on the roadmap.  It would be great to have a default filter by status, date, or other criteria (label, etc).  This relates to https://jira.atlassian.com/browse/JSWCLOUD-17799, which is to have a customizable timeline.
fields.summary: Classic Software Roadmap - Default filters

fields.description:
h3. Summary

Currently, using the exclusion rules, users can remove issues associated with specific releases but users cannot exclude issues with no release from the plan.

As a Jira Advanced Roadmaps user, I want to have the possibility to remove issues without a release from the plan using exclusion rules.

h3. Workaround

Create a filter that excludes the issues without releases and use it as the issue source of the plan
fields.summary: As a Jira Advanced Roadmaps user, I want to have the possibility to remove issues without a release from the plan

fields.description:
h3. Issue Summary
When setting up a plan, if you decide to remove a completed issue from it, once you commit this action you won't be able to add the issue again in the Plan.
The issue will disappear from the Removed Issues section under the Plan settings.

h3. Steps to Reproduce
# Have the Exclusion rules for completed issues set for 30 days (for example)
# Remove a *completed* issue from your plan
# Check the ‘Removed Issues’ section in Plans settings: issue is still there
# Commit the change
# Issue disappears from ‘Removed Issues’ section and you can't re-include it anymore.

h3. Expected Results
Be able to add the completed issue back

h3. Actual Results
Issue disappears from ‘Removed Issues’ section

h3. Workaround
No workaround at the moment
fields.summary: Completed issues disappear from the Removed Issues section if you commit the change

fields.description:
h3. Issue Summary
In some dashboard gadgets like the Sprint burndown gadget or the workload pie chart gadget, we notice a vertical scroll bar even though the entire gadget content fits the gadget screen. 

h3. Steps to Reproduce
1. Create a dashboard
2. Add a Sprint burndown gadget or Workload pie chart 
3. Populate the required fields and save the gadget

h3. Expected Results
The entire gadget should display without a vertical scroll bar if there is no additional content to be scrolled.

h3. Actual Results
We notice a vertical scroll which is not required as the gadget content fits correctly in the gadget screen.

h3. Workaround

Currently there is no known workaround for this behavior. A workaround will be added here when available
fields.summary: Some dashboard gadgets have a vertical scroll bar even though the gadget content fits the screen

fields.description:
h3. Issue Summary
When moving issues to a next-gen project, when mapping the statuses to the destination project there is no displaying logical order, as you can see it below:
 !image-2020-11-11-10-30-20-944.png|thumbnail! 
Next-gen workflow/columns:
 !image-2020-11-11-10-30-40-340.png|thumbnail! 
 !screenshot-1.png|thumbnail! 

h3. Steps to Reproduce
# Bulk move issues;
# Select a next-gen project as a destination;
# When mapping statuses, open the box to select the new status;

h3. Expected Results

Display in the order of the workflow/columns *or* with the status that has the same name from the source project.


h3. Workaround

Currently, there is no known workaround for this behavior. A workaround will be added here when available
fields.summary: The order of the statuses is displayed incorrectly when moving issues to a next-gen projects

fields.description:
Add the possibility to collapse and expand the area on the top of the sprint board.

It not need to use many times (filters and features that presented there is), So, it better to give the possibility to hide/show it. Look how it works on the left menu. It will save screen space on laptops by hiding features that are not needed to use ofter.

!image-2020-11-11-15-07-35-099.png!
fields.summary: Add the possibility to collapse and expand the area on the top of the board

fields.description:
h3. Summary

As a user, I would like to use the DevOps automation triggers to be compatible with Bamboo. Currently, this only works with Cloud applications.
fields.summary: Allow DevOps Automation triggers to work with Bamboo

fields.description:
h3. Problem

Currently, we can see only the date range for Epics that doesn't include the start and end date of the child issues.
h3. Suggestion

Add the date range separately for each child issues.
fields.summary: Date range for child issues on classic roadmap

fields.description:
h3. Issue Summary
If you try to search for a removed issue in a AR Plan, the search box will not lead you to the issue.

h3. Steps to Reproduce
# Remove an issue from a AR Plan
# Go to Removed issues section from Plan settings
# Try to search for the removed issue.
(problem is visible when you have many issues in the page)

h3. Expected Results
The search will leads you to the issue in case it's listed there.

h3. Actual Results
A purple markdown will appear in the issue, but you'll need to scroll down the page until you see it.

h3. Workaround
Consider using CTRL+F from your browser for now.
fields.summary: Search box from Removed Issues is not working properly

fields.description: This is only a test.
fields.summary: Test

fields.description:
*Summary:*

"Releases Panel(Deployment)" appears on parent issue view if moving back to the parent issue, through click to back on the browser, from subtask having deployment information(Release panel)

*Steps to reproduce:(New issue view)*

1. Create a subtask under the parent issue.
 2. Add subtask issue key in the (deployment)commit.
 3. Deployment information will appear on Subtask.
 4. Open the parent issue >> Select the subtask, having deployment information from the list.
 !image-2020-11-09-12-16-55-528.png|width=368,height=167!

5. Subtask has deployment information under Releases Panel
 !image-2020-11-09-12-20-05-782.png|width=368,height=167!
 6. Click to go back arrow on the browser
 !image-2020-11-09-12-23-31-469.png|width=362,height=34!  
 7. Parent issue will show the deployment information of subtask(Releases Panel)
 !image-2020-11-09-12-24-54-166.png|width=368,height=167!
 !image-2020-11-09-12-25-15-102.png|height=167!

*Actual result:*
 Parent issue shows the deployment information of subtask(Releases Panel)

*Expected result:*
 The parent issue should not display the deployment information(releases panel) from subtask.

*Workaround:*
 Refresh the parent issue page, and deployment information(releases panel)from subtask will disappear.
fields.summary: "Releases Panel(Deployment)" appears on parent issue view if subtask has deployment information(Release panel)

fields.description:
h3. Issue Summary

When in Project settings > Opsgenie page, clicking on the Jira Settings cog icon (or any of the other Jira Navigation Secondary Actions items) doesn't show the drop-down menu
h3. Steps to Reproduce
 # In a classic project, navigate to Project settings > Opsgenie page
 # Now click Jira settings/cogwheel and the drop-down doesn't show up

h3. Expected Results

Jira Settings drop-down menu should show up when the user is on the Opsgenie page
h3. Actual Results

Clicking on the cog wheel doesn't show the drop-down when the user navigates to the Opsgenie page
h3. Workaround

Currently, there is no known workaround for this behavior. To see the drop-down menus for secondary actions, the user must first navigate to any other page.
fields.summary: Jira Settings drop-down menu doesn't open when Opsgenie is selected from project settings

fields.description:
h3. Issue Summary
Deleting story point estimate does not appear in sprint burndown report
h3. Steps to Reproduce
 # Start a sprint with an issue without a story point estimate on it
 # Add an estimate to the issue
 # Go to the sprint burndown and see the change appears in the scope change table
 # Delete the estimate from the issue (delete, not set to 0)
 # Go to sprint burndown see the change does not appear in the scope change table

h3. Expected Results
The change should appear in the scope burndown table
h3. Actual Results
Changes do not appear

h3. Workaround

Currently, there is no known workaround for this behavior. A workaround will be added here when available
fields.summary: Deleting story point estimate does not appear in sprint burndown report

fields.description:
We need to be able to determine our team's actual capacity, as well as the related work load.
 
We are looking for a feature similar to Microsoft Azure DevOps' capacity feature. 
See [here |https://github.com/C-B4](the "Review Capacity Charts" especially).
 
Main features:
 # Be able to set each team member's capacity, individually.
 # (Nice to have) be able to set days off for the entire team
 # Be able to graphically see workload by team and by each team member.
 # Be able to see what contributes to the above mentioned workload, task wise.
 # Be able to calculate workload by either tasks/subtasks/user stories (default: sub tasks).
 # (Nice to have) be able to set different types of roles (e.g. developer, QA etc.) and see workload by role.

It seems that there is a rather basic work load feature in Jira, but it doesn't work with sub tasks.
 
How can we enable such features in Jira as well?
fields.summary: Workload and capacity for team members

fields.description:
h3. Issue Summary

When you move an issue from one project to another (it can be from next-gen to classic, classic to next-gen, or classic to classic), the sprint field value is kept and it makes the sprint from another project to be visible on the board of the new project

h3. Steps to Reproduce
# Create project A and project B using the Scrum template
# Create a sprint in project A
# Create an issue in project A and add it to the sprint that has not been started on the SCRUM board.
# Open the issue and go to More >> Move. Move the issue to project B.

h3. Expected Results

The sprint field is empty and the moved issue is visible in the backlog

h3. Actual Results

The sprint field value remains and the sprint of project A is visible on the board of project B

h3. Workaround

Remove the issue from the sprint or delete the sprint before moving the issue (or issues) to another project
fields.summary: Moving an issue to another project does not remove issue from sprints

fields.description:
Currently, if you have more than 10 sprints on your team-managed (formerly next-gen) project, Jira will only display a list of the 10 newest sprints on this project when seeing a report, such as Sprint Burndown chart. 
 !image-2020-11-06-09-24-46-594.png|thumbnail! 

h3. Suggestion
Displaying all the sprints on this list so users can manage their projects correctly.
fields.summary: Display all the sprints on a report from a team-managed (formerly next-gen) project

fields.description:
When a ticket is assigned, the assignee user profile icon appears to the right of the priority indicator and pushes it inward. In a list of tickets where some are unassigned and some assigned, the priority indicators do not line up.

It would great if the priority indicator stayed at the end of the ticket row or was aligned with the indicator on an assigned ticket.
fields.summary: Align priority arrow for unassigned tickets in the backlog

fields.description: Users would like to be able to see the rolled-up values from inside issues and epics instead of having to go to the Plan view to access the information.
fields.summary: Make Roll-Up functionality of Advanced Roadmaps visible inside issues

fields.description:
h3. Issue Summary
A customer has reported a slow loading plan. Our investigation showed that a significantly large amount of sprints in the plan can cause the plan to load slowly.

h3. Steps to Reproduce
 # Have a significantly large number of releases in your plan (>750)

h3. Expected Results
Plan loads at normal speed

h3. Actual Results
 Plan can take a significant amount of time (>20 seconds) to load.

h3. Workaround
Manually removed old releases from the Releases section
fields.summary: Having a significantly large number of releases slows Advanced Roadmaps loading performance

fields.description:
h3. Issue Summary
Advanced Roadmaps allows issue to have circular reference between Epic and issue on a level above

h3. Steps to Reproduce
# Create an Initiative in the Plan view in Advanced Roadmaps
# Create an Epic under this Initiative in Advanced Roadmaps (now the Epic has a Parent Link set to the Initiative)
# Go to the Initiative's issue view (not in the Advanced Roadmaps), and set the Epic Link field to the Epic

h3. Expected Results
Jira wouldn't allow the Epic to be both parent and child of the Initiative and vice-versa.

h3. Actual Results
Jira allows the Epic to be both parent and child of the Initiative and vice-versa and there is not message stating it.

h3. Workaround
 Currently there is no known workaround for this behavior. A workaround will be added here when available
fields.summary: Advanced Roadmaps allows issue to have circular reference between Epic and issue on a level above

fields.description:
As a Jira Project administrator, I would like the option to schedule my sprints to start and end, by the dates and times I have selected and to have options automatically implemented, so less manual work is required and consistency is maintained from sprint to sprint.

I would like to have options when it comes to starting/completing sprints:
 # Who can start/complete sprints (and options to add back-ups) - more than the permissions allow
 # Provide a method for a naming convention (choosing fields to use and in an order we can choose)
 # Select start date and time
 # Select end date and time
 # Choose whether I want this to be auto-scheduled, and for how long
 # Choose what to do with items that are not "done"
 ## Move items to the backlog
 ### if the last active date was more than X days before the sprint was completed
 ### if the story is less than x % complete
 ### whatever other condition the teams choose to implement
 ## Move items to the next sprint
 ### if the last active date was less than X days before the sprint was completed
 ### if the story is more than x % complete
 ### Priority is X
 ### the story points are X
 ### whatever other condition the teams choose to implement
 # Options to send out a notification of the sprint results (completed/moved to backlog/moved to next sprint)
 # Option to create a report from the results - not the Jira reports, but of what we want to see, from the available metadata
fields.summary: Sprint Start/End Automation with Options

fields.description:
h3. Issue Summary

Users are unable to create, edit and delete the connected repository shortcuts. 
 We notice different behaviour of the "_Add item_" button in the project sidebar and it seems to be connected to the "Code" tab under project settings.
h3. Steps to Reproduce

Open a Jira software project > Click on "_Add item_" > Try to create a repository
 * We do not see the option to create a repository from the "Add item" option in the project side bar. We only have the option to create a shortcut.

 * If the Bitbucket or Git repositories already created in the project side bar, we notice that we are not able to delete them.

h3. Expected Results

Users should be able to create, edit and delete repositories from the project sidebar
h3. Actual Results

Users can create, edit and delete repositories only if they navigate to the "Code" section of the project settings.
h3. Workaround

1. Open a Jira software project and try to add a shortcut using "Add item" option. We see the following screen:

!Screenshot 2020-11-05 at 4.26.56 PM.png|width=334,height=246!

2. Now navigate to the "Code" section under project settings (No changes are required in the
 "Code" page). Once the page loads, navigate "Back to project" and click on "Add item". We are now able to see the option of adding repositories, shortcuts and pages:
 * _Project settings > Code_
 * _Back to project > Add Item_

!Screenshot 2020-11-05 at 4.27.32 PM.png|width=340,height=261!

(Refreshing the page again defaults the "Add item" behaviour to creating only shortcuts)
fields.summary: Users are unable to create, edit and delete the repository shortcuts in the project sidebar

fields.description:
h3. Issue Summary
Jira's DVCS GitHub connector uses the "access_token" query parameter which is now a deprecated authentication method for the GitHub API
*note:* for GitHub Enterprise accounts DVCS is in use, other GitHub accounts use the GitHub App.

h3. Steps to Reproduce
  # Go to Jira Administration > Application > DVCS Accounts
 # Click on "Link Bitbucket Cloud and GitHub accounts" button
 # Provide details for GitHub (check screen shot) and proceed. 
 # Make sure that Jira syncs this GitHub data at least once

h3. Expected Results
The integration works without any problems.

h3. Actual Results
GitHub is currently emailing administrators to inform them that they have an integration that is using this deprecated authentication method. The message looks like this:
{quote}
Hi,

On February 4th, 2020 at 14:01 (UTC) your application (JIRA DVCS) used an access token (with the User-Agent Java/1.8.0_151) as part of a query parameter to access an endpoint through the GitHub API:

[https://api.github.com/repositories/229755391/hooks]

Please use the Authorization HTTP header instead as using the `access_token` query parameter is deprecated.

Depending on your API usage, we'll be sending you this email reminder once every 3 days for each token and User-Agent used in API calls made on your behalf.
Just one URL that was accessed with a token and User-Agent combination will be listed in the email reminder, not all.

Visit [https://developer.github.com/changes/2019-11-05-deprecated-passwords-and-authorizations-api/#authenticating-using-query-parameters] for more information.

Thanks,
The GitHub Team{quote}


h3. Workaround
 Currently there is no known workaround for this behavior. A workaround will be added here when available
fields.summary: Jira's DVCS GitHub connector uses the "access_token" query parameter which is a deprecated authentication method for the GitHub API

fields.description:
h3. Issue Summary

If the issue type scheme that associated to the project doesn't have any child issue type, clicking on add child issue button on Roadmap will cause the page to go blank with error notification.
h3. Steps to Reproduce
 # Make sure the issue type scheme that associated to the project doesn't have any child issue type.
 # Go to Jira Roadmap.
 # Click on "+" (Add child issue button) on the epic issue.

h3. Expected Results

Add child issue button shouldn't be clickable if the project doesn't have any child issue type.
h3. Actual Results

Add child issue button is visible and clickable, the page breaks when user clicks on it.
h3. Workaround

Do not click on "+" (Add child issue button) on the epic issue if the project doesn't have any child issue type.
fields.summary: Clicking on add child issue button on Roadmap will cause the page to go blank

fields.description:
Currently updating the status of issues that appear on the Advanced Roadmap plan can be done by clicking and updating the issue itself. 

It will be very useful if there is an option to update issue status from the Advanced Roadmap plan directly.

 !screenshot-1.png|thumbnail!
fields.summary: Allow update of issue status directly on the Advanced Roadmap plan

fields.description:
h3. *Problem*

The Roadmap for company-managed (formerly classic) projects is now available, but it's not possible to use it on Jira Cloud for Mac or Android/iOS app.
h3. *Suggestion*

Make Roadmap for company-managed (formerly classic) projects available on Mobile/Mac app the same as team-managed (formerly next-gen) roadmaps.
fields.summary: Ability to view Roadmap (company-managed project) on Mobile app and Jira Cloud for Mac

fields.description:
h3. Suggestion

When creating sub task from a parent task, it should copy the Fix Version from the parent issue.
Additionally, when the parent's Fix Version changes, the sub-tasks' could change as well.

h3. Steps to Replicate

# Create a test project
# Create some issues
# Create some version
# Assign fix version to one of the issue
# Create subtask 

h3. Expected Result

Subtask created with Fix Version populated

h3. Alternative solutions

h4. Workflow

# Add post function in the create transition, (select the text mode > select the first step > you will see {{create}} transition on your left)
# Select {{Copy Value From Other Field}}
# Click next, select {{FixVersions}} as the source field and destination, for the option pick {{copy from parent}}
# Publish the workflow

h4. Automation Rules

Configure Automation Actions that allow you to achieve this.
fields.summary: Fix Version is not Copied to Subtask when Creating Subtask

fields.description:
h3. Issue Summary

Workflow transition via smart commits does not work as expected if the workflow transition name contains accented characters
 * This seems to occur only if the transition name contains accented character in the first word (Example: réalisation-terminée)
 * If the first word contains non-accented characters, then the workflow transition is working as expected (Example: recette-terminée)

h3. Steps to Reproduce
 # Create a Jira software project
 # Associate a workflow with project such that:
 a) The transition name of the same status contains accented characters (Example: réalisation-terminée) 
b) Enable "Allow all statuses to transition to this one" for the destination status
 # Integrate Jira cloud with a development tool such as Github or Gitlab for Jira
 # Perform a smart commit from the development tool to perform a workflow transition
 Example:
{code:java}
Test example.txt TEST-123 #réalisation-terminée{code}

h3. Expected Results

The issue should be transitioned to the destination status via the transition (In this case: réalisation-terminée)
h3. Actual Results

The issue is not transitioned to the destination status even though we notice that the commit information is seen in the ticket
h3. Workaround

Rename the workflow transition name to include non-accented characters in the first word.
fields.summary: Workflow transition via smart commits does not work as expected if the workflow transition name contains accented characters

fields.description:
h3. Issue Summary
Jira Rest API's accept a URL in SSH and HTTP format, however automation triggers only work when the URL is supplied in HTTP format. 

h3. Steps to Reproduce
 # Step 1
Use the JIRA Development Information API to store repository details, providing the repository URL in SSH format, for example 

{code:java}
{
  "id": "d2e56c5c-5cae-4852-9fc6-4f25abee7212",
  "url": "git@bitbucket.org:repo12.git",
  "name": "repo12",
  "avatar": "my-avatar-url",
  "commits": [],
  "branches": [],
  "description": "The repo1 repository",
  "pullRequests": [],
  "updateSequenceId": 2,
  "avatarDescription": "Something witty"
}
{code}

 # Step 2
Create an [automation trigger for a 'Commit Created' event|https://support.atlassian.com/jira-software-cloud/docs/automation-triggers/], then create a commit in your repository. 

h3. Expected Results
An error is displayed when the URL is supplied in the incorrect format; OR
Automation events are triggered for SSH URL's

h3. Actual Results
No error is displayed when the URL is supplied in SSH format; AND
Automation events are not triggered for SSH URL's 

h3. Workaround
Entering all URL's in HTTP format and not SSH format.
fields.summary: Adding a repository with a SSH URL using the Development Information API doesn't give an error or trigger automation events

fields.description:
Currently, in classic projects when trying to close a Sprint Jira will check if the status of the Subtasks is in the right-most column from the mapped statuses and not if the Status category is a done one, if the status is mapped in a different column Jira will not recognize it as completed even though the status has a done category.

The error that the Sprint shows is the following:
Sprint cannot be completed as there are incomplete subtasks on the following issues
fields.summary: Make possible to close a sprint taking in consideration the sub-task status category and not the column

fields.description:
As a dashboard creator

I want dashboard layouts to match my intent

So they improve visibility of the information and reduce maintenance work

 

Acceptance criteria:
 * Dashboards have options for column layout, free form layout (floating as with unjustified text), and snap to grid.  Grid size is selectable.
 * Dashboard gadgets use standard sizing breakpoints, so they align to the column/grid layout selected
 * Marketplace vendor gadgets adhere to the standard sizing breakpoints before they are accepted for marketplace use.  When a gadget does not, it's view is constrained to the breakpoint.  (Thus when it looks terrible because they don't fix their gadget, consumers will influence their behavior by not using their tool. :^)
 * Additional wallboard gadgets for spacing are added.  Their size can be set in their options, including spacers with no text, borders, or line-bars.
 * Bonus: changes to dashboards are versioned, such as with Confluence, allowing editing and previewing changes before publishing, and roll-back, as needed.
fields.summary: improvements to dashboard layouts

fields.description:
It'd be great to have a way to visually represent the subjective progress of our epics, ie by dragging a bullet on a hill chart like Basecamp offers. 

 

https://basecamp.com/features/hill-charts
fields.summary: Add an Hill Charts feature

fields.description:
h3. Issue Summary

In Advanced Roadmaps, the share link feature isn't respecting the selected view. If you select different views and generate the link, all links redirect to the last view selected.

(on) This bug also affects *links for Confluence*.
h3. Steps to Reproduce
 # Create an Advanced Roadmaps plan with some issues
 # In *Views*, select one of the options available (*Basic*, for example)
 # Click *Share*, then click *Copy* and paste the link in a text editor
 # In *Views*, select another option available (*Dependency management*, for example)
 # Click *Share*, then click *Copy* and paste the link in a text editor
 # Now, in two different tabs in the browser, paste the 2 links generated and hit the enter key to access them

h3. Expected Results

You see the different views in the tabs
h3. Actual Results

Both tabs display the same view, the last one you have selected
h3. Workaround

After generating the first link, open it on a new tab on the browser. Note that, after the page loads, the link will change and some parameters will be added to it. One of them, is the *{{&vid=x (where x would be the ID (int) of the view)}}*

If you use this link (with the view parameter) to share the roadmap, the view will be kept, even if you change the view on the roadmap. 

If you would like to display an specific view on a Confluence page, use this workaround to get the shareable link with the view parameter, and then use the iFrame macro to embed it (instead of the advanced roadmaps macro). The advanced roadmap macro only accepts links to share on Confluence, and it's not possible to add the view parameter on them.
fields.summary: In Advanced Roadmaps, the share link feature isn't respecting the selected view

fields.description:
h3. Summary

As described in [Working With Plans|https://confluence.atlassian.com/advancedroadmapscloud/working-with-plans-998651020.html] there is a 5000 issue limit to what a Plan is capable of handling. Despite this limit, users can still include issues way beyond this limit when configuring the *Issue source* which will ultimately lead to performance problems.

h3. Propose solution

To avoid the unexpected surprise of performance problems in Advanced Roadmap and also make users aware of this limit, a warning should be displayed in the *Confirm what's in scope* step. This warning can either always be visible as a banner or only trigger when more than the acceptable limit has been selected.
fields.summary: Add issue limit warning when configuring issue source

fields.description:
Submitting this as a suggestion as I am unable to enter a defect...

For automation smart values, when the commit message is multi-line, only the first line is returned by the smart value.
fields.summary: smart value for commit message truncates after line-break

fields.description:
The roadmap feature is currently only working if the filter does not contain issues of any project other than the current project that the board is attached to.

I suggest to enable the roadmap as soon as the filter contains only one project - no matter which project it is. This should also include service desk projects.

Use Case:

Roadmap should be enabled for project "SOFTWARE" that only contains issues of project "SERVICEDESK".
fields.summary: Enable Roadmap feature for filter containing one single other project

fields.description:
Hi,

It's will be very useful if we be able to place a story directly under a Initiative.

Sometime we have Story don't include in a Epic because it's not a part of a Epic. But we need this Story under a initiative because it's a story to integrate an already developed Epic.
fields.summary: Allow Story to be place under Initiative directly

fields.description:
The new Highest Priority icon looks like a forbidden sign, and it's very confusing !

I'm looking for a way to bring this up to your design team, so they can change it back to a double arrow icon, for example.
fields.summary: The new Highest Priority icon is confusing

fields.description:
h3. Issue Summary

If a swimlane is expanded while viewing an active sprint board and an additional quick filter is chosen to include more issues, then the expanded swimlane gets collapsed and reordered. Another swimlane takes its place and gets expanded. 
This behaviour causes confusion to the users.
h3. Steps to Reproduce

1. Create a Jira Scrum Classic project
 2. Set swimlanes to Stories in the board settings
 3. In the active sprint board view, collapse all swimlanes and select a assignee filter (Example: User1)
 4. Expand one swimlanes from the list of stories. (Example: 4th swimlane in the list)
 5. Now click on an addition assignee filter (Example: User1 and User2)
h3. Expected Results

The expanded swimlane should stay expanded in the same position (4th position as per above steps).
h3. Actual Results

The expanded swimlane is collapsed and reordered in the list of stories. Another story gets expanded and takes the position of the previously expanded swimlane.
h3. Workaround

Currently there is no known workaround for this behavior. A workaround will be added here when available
fields.summary: Expanded swimlane is collapsed and reordered upon including additional issue based on a quick filter

fields.description: As a project manager, I should be having an option to create multiple backlogs within a single Scrum project to ease the segregation of issues on the backlog view and work on them accordingly.
fields.summary: Option to create multiple backlogs

fields.description:
As a Scrum Master,

I would like to version/releases to be displayed on the ROADMAP, 

So that the business and project stakeholders can easily visualise when releases will be available.

The reasoning behind this request is that EPIC's don't generally get released, however, rather stories are.  These stories can be grouped in release/versions.

In addition, it would be helpful if the release/version could be expanded/collapsed to show which stories or tasks are included in each release.
fields.summary: ROADMAP View:  Display project by Version/Release

fields.description:
h3. Issue Summary

Using arrow key to view attachment in the issue does not work past four attachments
h3. Steps to Reproduce
 # Attach 6-10 attachments on any issue
 # Click on first attachment to open 
 # Use the right arrow to view next attachment
 # After fourth attachment, right arrow would disappear
 # Left arrow would still show to view previous attachments

h3. Expected Results
 * All attachments should be available to view and the arrow should not disappear

h3. Actual Results

Arrow disappears and in order to view the rest of the attachments, we need click on fifth attachment and open it and then progress with next four. [^Jira Issue - Attachments.docx]
h3. Workaround

None
fields.summary: Scrolling through Attachments in an Issue does not work after

fields.description:
Currently if a new Epic is added to the Roadmap, its color will be a random one in classic projects and purple in NextGen projects. (The color can be changed later)
It would be good to have an option to set the default color for newly added Epics.
fields.summary: Option for default color of Epics on Roadmap

fields.description:
Many times I find myself wanting to create a new issue when linking to an issue.

Here is the scenario.

I have an issue reported to me. On investigation I find the issue is caused by an issue in another project. So I need to report an issue in the other project (a project managed by another team in our organisation.)

It would be great if I could create the issue directly from my issue screen rather than closing my issue, going over to the other project, logging the issue, coming back to my project and my issue and then linking to the new issue.
fields.summary: Create linked issue from existing issue

fields.description: test
fields.summary: test

fields.description:
As a user, having only 55 possible options in a dropdown or checkbox fields on Next-gen projects is not enough:

 !image-2020-09-15-10-28-43-487.png|thumbnail!
fields.summary: Raise the limit options in a dropdown or checkbox fields on Next-gen projects

fields.description:
h3. Issue Summary

+Move to Done+ button doesn't disappear from Kanban boards if the *Kanban board sub-filter* is set to not show that issue and the swimlanes are based on Stories.
h3. Steps to Reproduce
 # Create a Story inside a Kanban board
 # Create subtasks below that Story
 # Set the Kanban board sub-filter to *fixVersion is EMPTY* (just an example)
 ** The important thing is to set some Kanban board sub-filter that shouldn't show the Story
 # Make sure the subtasks respect the Kanban board sub-filter (in my example, the fixVersion for subtasks need to be EMPTY)
 # Set some fixVersion on the Story (the Story should still be shown there since it has subtasks below it that respect the Kanban board sub-filter
 # Move all subtasks to Done
 # The +Move to Done+ button will appear on your board
 # You can move that issue to Done using any possible way, but that button will continue there.

h3. Expected Results

The button should disappear if that Story was already moved to Done.
h3. Actual Results

The button still appears, independently if you moved that Story Done:

!image-2020-10-21-14-36-52-410.png|width=643,height=197!
h3. Workaround

Currently, the only possible workaround should be to not have that Story "excluded" by the Kanban board sub-filter.
fields.summary: Move to Done button doesn't disappear from Kanban boards

fields.description:
h3. Issue Summary
A Next Gen project is nos display the information from Time Tracking when clicking on this field if the issue has a subtask. 
 !image-2020-10-21-11-42-53-506.png|thumbnail! 
A white page appears if you click on Time Tracking on the full issue view. 

h3. Steps to Reproduce
# Access the board from a Next Gen project
# Click on an issue +with a subtask+
# Click on Time Tracking field

h3. Expected Results
 !image (7).png|thumbnail! 

h3. Actual Results
 !image-2020-10-21-11-42-53-506.png|thumbnail! 

h3. Workaround
Add the Time Tracking field to the Subtask will prevent this error from happening.
fields.summary: Clicking on Time Tracking field on Next Gen project gets a white screen if the issue has subtasks

fields.description:
As a software engineer using Jira I faced the following case:

I want to write a comment to a Jira issue in which I want to link another comment which is related to the same issue. So nothing happens if I try to click on the link routed to the another comment. 
If I link a comment which is related to another Jira issue everything works fine, so I will be redirected to the linked Jira issue and the linked comment would be focused for me.



I think it would be great in such cases the UI to be interactively moved and focused to a linked comment.
fields.summary: Ability to directly move page to a linked comment in a Jira issue

fields.description:
h3. Problem Statement

As per the following documentation: [Enable the roadmap|https://support.atlassian.com/jira-software-cloud/docs/enable-the-roadmap], the Next-gen Roadmap can display a maximum of 3000 issues or 300 Epics at the moment, and after that limit the functionality will not longer work.
h3. Suggestions:
 * Provide the ability to increase the number of Issues/Epics that can be displayed on the Roadmaps.
 * Display a warning when the limit is about to be reached.

h3. Workarounds:

- Mark Epics as Done and/or backdate the due date, e.g to more than one year ago.

- Move old issues to other projects
fields.summary: Increase Issues/Epic limit for Jira Next-gen / Team-Managed roadmap

fields.description:
**In next-gen projects, many crucial keyboard shortcuts do not work. Especially j, k, n, and p to navigate issues have no effect. Others like / for search do work. But as soon as an issue is open the shortcuts are not working.

I understand this is expected in board view while the shortcut works only in Issue view of the classic project but these shortcuts are very useful ones.
fields.summary: Keyboard Shortcuts are like next and previous issue/activity not working in next-gen project

fields.description:
h3. *Summary*

The CSV import will fail if a team-managed (formerly next-gen) project's field is mapped during the import.

The following message is displayed:
 !Screen Shot 2018-10-31 at 10.05.26.png|thumbnail! 

{panel:title=Update 11th May 2020|borderStyle=solid|borderColor=#3399ff|titleBGColor=#3399ff|bgColor=#e0e0e0}
You now get the following error message:
{noformat}
Unexpected failure occurred. Importer will stop immediately. Data may be in an unstable state: At least one given IssueParentAssociations must not be empty!
{noformat}

{panel}

Detailed logs:
{code}
2018-10-31 13:00:36,645 INFO - Import started by admin using com.atlassian.jira.plugins.importer.imports.csv.CsvDataBean
2018-10-31 13:00:36,824 INFO - ------------------------------
2018-10-31 13:00:36,824 INFO - Importing: Users
2018-10-31 13:00:36,824 INFO - ------------------------------
2018-10-31 13:00:36,824 INFO - Only new items will be imported
2018-10-31 13:00:36,827 INFO - 0 users associated with import. All of them imported as inactive, this can be changed after import in User Access step.
2018-10-31 13:00:36,827 INFO - ------------------------------
2018-10-31 13:00:36,827 INFO - Finished Importing : Users
2018-10-31 13:00:36,827 INFO - ------------------------------
2018-10-31 13:00:36,827 INFO - 0 users successfully created.
2018-10-31 13:00:36,829 INFO - Retrieving projects...
2018-10-31 13:00:36,839 INFO - Project ExternalProject{id='null', key='NG', externalName='null', name='Next gen', type='null', template='null'} exists and found correctly.
2018-10-31 13:00:36,842 INFO - ------------------------------
2018-10-31 13:00:36,842 INFO - Importing: Versions
2018-10-31 13:00:36,842 INFO - ------------------------------
2018-10-31 13:00:36,842 INFO - Only new items will be imported
2018-10-31 13:00:36,842 INFO - ------------------------------
2018-10-31 13:00:36,842 INFO - Finished Importing : Versions
2018-10-31 13:00:36,842 INFO - ------------------------------
2018-10-31 13:00:36,842 INFO - ------------------------------
2018-10-31 13:00:36,842 INFO - Importing: Components
2018-10-31 13:00:36,842 INFO - ------------------------------
2018-10-31 13:00:36,842 INFO - Only new items will be imported
2018-10-31 13:00:36,842 INFO - ------------------------------
2018-10-31 13:00:36,842 INFO - Finished Importing : Components
2018-10-31 13:00:36,842 INFO - ------------------------------
2018-10-31 13:00:36,846 INFO - Retrieving custom fields...
2018-10-31 13:00:36,850 INFO - ------------------------------
2018-10-31 13:00:36,850 INFO - Importing: Issues
2018-10-31 13:00:36,850 INFO - ------------------------------
2018-10-31 13:00:36,850 INFO - Only new items will be imported
2018-10-31 13:00:36,898 INFO - Importing issue: [externalId='autoid-8429087420537541515', summary='Summary']
2018-10-31 13:00:36,908 INFO - ------------------------------
2018-10-31 13:00:36,908 INFO - Finished Importing : Issues

{code}

h3. Environment

Jira Cloud

h3. Steps to Reproduce

* Create a CSV file (example:  [^test.csv] )
* Go to the *External system import* section -> select *CSV*;
* Select a team-managed (formerly next-gen) project to import the issue to:
 !Screen Shot 2018-10-31 at 09.59.53.png|thumbnail! 
* Map the fields (make sure to map one of the target project's fields):
 !Screen Shot 2018-10-31 at 10.00.17.png|thumbnail! 

The import is not successful.

h3. Suggestion

Support CSV imports in team-managed (formerly next-gen) projects.
fields.summary: Team-managed (formerly next-gen) projects do not support CSV imports

fields.description:
{panel:title=Atlassian status as of November 2021|borderStyle=solid|borderColor=#b2d4ff|titleBGColor=#b2d4ff|bgColor=#eaf1fc}
Hello all,

Thank you for watching, voting, and commenting on this issue. We hear you that not being able to use global custom fields in team-managed projects is a barrier to adopting the project type more broadly.

The good news is that we are now laying the groundwork for Jira admins to add global custom fields to team-managed projects. I’ll keep you updated with our estimated completion date.

In the meantime, do add comments on how and why your teams would want to use custom fields in team-managed project so that we can build products that suit your needs.

Thank you,
 Carol Low
 Product Manager
{panel}
h3. Summary 

Team-managed projects are the perfect tool for getting non-technical teams into Jira and are finding early success with this. 

Meanwhile, it is important that a balance is struck between organization-wide structure and the "do it yourself" mentality of next-gen projects. We have configured important custom fields on our "classic" projects that help us keep in sync and report cross-team. 

As such, please allow custom fields to be shared across team-managed projects and company-managed projects.
fields.summary: Team-managed projects to share custom fields

fields.description:
As a Product Manager, I'm enjoying the flexibility of the new Jira next-gen projects. But we also use Tempo for our time tracking, and I'm missing the ability to tie specific issues to specific Accounts for tempo time tracking.

I saw that adding Tempo fields was a goal of the new Issue Detail view, and it was prioritized and fixed fairly quickly! I'm hoping the same can occur on these NextGen projects. Thanks!
fields.summary: Ability to edit the Tempo Account field in NextGen projects

fields.description: Allow the backlog view in team-managed (formerly next-gen) projects to sort the order of issues by fields like priority.
fields.summary: Team-managed (formerly next-gen) order by field in backlog

fields.description:
{panel:title=Atlassian status as of February 2021|borderStyle=solid|borderColor=#b2d4ff|titleBGColor=#b2d4ff|bgColor=#eaf1fc}
Hello all,

Thank you for watching, voting, and commenting on this issue.

We use this data as well as many other inputs to feed into our prioritisation process. Having multiple subtask issue types is something that we may consider in the future, although it is not something that we will be focusing on in the next year. We want to share this with you to ensure you can plan out your use of projects within Jira Software effectively.

Please continue to vote and in particular please continue to add comments on how your team would find value when having multiple subtask issue types. This contextual information of what you are doing and why you are doing is invaluable for us in providing you with a product that will grow with your needs.

Thank you,
Eoin Ryan
Product Manager
{panel}

Now, we have only a single sub-task issue type in Jira next-gen.

It would be great if the ability to create multiple sub-task issue types could be implemented in Next-gen.
fields.summary: Allow the creation of Multiple Sub-task issue types in Team Managed projects

fields.description:
h3. Issue Summary

In the [Sharing Roadmaps page for the Advanced Roadmaps product|https://confluence.atlassian.com/advancedroadmapscloud/sharing-roadmaps-998651329.html], it states that a macro called *Advanced Roadmaps for Jira* can be installed in Confluence, but, Confluence Cloud does not have the macro available through Marketplace either as a bundled one.

(i) [This macro can be downloaded for the Server edition|https://marketplace.atlassian.com/apps/1221237/advanced-roadmaps-for-jira-in-confluence?hosting=server&tab=overview] and there is also a [suggestion to implement it for Confluence|https://jira.atlassian.com/browse/CONFCLOUD-70177].
{quote}
When you share a roadmap in a Confluence page, it will inherit any filters and settings you've configured on your roadmap like issue hierarchy, filters, timeline date range, view settings, and more.

To share a roadmap on a Confluence page, you need to make sure that you have the *Advanced Roadmaps for Jira plan* macro installed in your Confluence instance. This can be downloaded from the [Atlassian Marketplace|https://marketplace.atlassian.com/search?hosting=cloud&product=confluence], provided you have the proper permissions in your instance. To learn more about adding macros to your instance, see [What are macros|https://confluence.atlassian.com/confcloud/macros-724765157.html].
{quote}

h3. Steps to Reproduce
 # Access [Sharing Roadmaps|https://confluence.atlassian.com/advancedroadmapscloud/sharing-roadmaps-998651329.html]
 # Try to follow the instructions to find the macro in the Marketplace or while editing a Confluence page.

h3. Expected Results
The macro should be available to be installed or used.

h3. Actual Results
The macro does not exist for Confluence Cloud or the documentation should be updated to remove the specific part mentioning the macro for Confluence while it is not available.

h3. Workaround
While the documentation should be updated, to embed a plan inside Confluence, the steps highlighted in the [suggestion to have it available|https://jira.atlassian.com/browse/CONFCLOUD-70177] can help.
fields.summary: Incorrect information on Advanced Roadmaps documentation

fields.description: There are multiple options to use as statistic type but the teams from advanced roadmaps is not one of them, it could be really helpful to have that option.
fields.summary: An option to use advanced roadmaps teams as statistic type in Pie chart gadget

fields.description:
h3. Summary

With the option to adjust the view settings to group by [labels|https://confluence.atlassian.com/advancedroadmapscloud/grouping-by-labels-998651107.html] or [components|https://confluence.atlassian.com/advancedroadmapscloud/grouping-by-components-998651102.html] you can create group swimlanes and assign their respective labels or components.

However, these groups are organized in chronological order with the oldest created group sitting on top of the newly created group with no option to re-organize them.

 !TST7_-_Advanced_Roadmaps_-_Jira.png|thumbnail! 

h3. Propose solution

This is problematic in a situation where the group at the bottom needs to be re-ordered to sit a the top and in this scenario you have no choice but to rename the existing top group and re-do the labels/components which can be time tedious.

As a solution, you should be able to drag and drop the groups in the view settings to re-order them as needed.
fields.summary: Re-ordering for grouping by labels and components

fields.description:
Allow Advanced Roadmaps admins to select just "all future releases" option while editing a issue source plan.
For large plans, if the admin select all releases, it can cause performance issues so, for now, they need to manually select release by release to avoid this.
fields.summary: Have the "all future releases" while selecting Releases to be imported in the Issue Source

fields.description:
h3. Issue Summary

Velocity Chart is not an option under Personal board
h3. Steps to Reproduce
 - Create a Scrum board with any filter and put it under Personal location instead of putting it under a project, except velocity chart all other graphs, charts will be available under the Reports section.

 - Create a Kanban board with any filter and put it under Personal location instead of putting it under a project, except velocity chart all other graphs, charts will be available under the Reports section as per the Kanban board.

 * 
 ** This is how it looks like when viewed under a project

  !screenshot-1.png|thumbnail! 
 ** Velocity Chart is not an option when viewed under a personal board.

 !screenshot-2.png|thumbnail! 
h3. Expected Results
 - We should see an option called *Velocity Chart* under reports unlike all other Scrum or Kanban board when the board is located under a project

h3. Actual Results
 - We do not see any *Velocity Chart* option under the Reports section

h3. Workaround

Look at the URL address bar and change the chart type like this:
* https://<siteName>.atlassian.net/secure/RapidBoard.jspa?rapidView=<boardId>&view=reporting&*chart=velocityChart*

(!) Remove any other information after *chart=* if it refers to other report types.
fields.summary: Velocity Chart is not an option under Personal board

fields.description:
h3. Issue Summary
When viewing the Commits tab on Jira issue view, the date is formatted in mm/dd/yyyy format, regardless of the Date/time format settings

h3. Steps to Reproduce
# Open an issue that contains commits in the development panel.
# Click the commits to view the dialog.

h3. Expected Results
The date is formatted using the dates formatted defined in the System -> Look and Feel settings.

h3. Actual Results
The date is formatted in mm/dd/yyyy format.


h3. Workaround
Click the link to view the entity in its native tool.
fields.summary: Commits on the Jira issue view are displayed in the wrong date format.

fields.description:
Currently, in the new issue view if you remove the Time tracking from the screens, context, and issue layout you are still being able to view the time tracking feature and log time. 

This does not happen in the Old issue view. 

*Workaround* 
Remove Time-tracking Permissions so users will not be able to edit the Time tracking.
fields.summary: Unable to hide time tracking in the new issue view

fields.description:
There is a new feature for next-gen projects where you can restrict the issue type visibility by project roles.
 !Screen Shot 2020-10-19 at 17.15.10.png|thumbnail!

However, the issue type restriction is only applied to new issues, it does not affect existing issues.
 !Screen Shot 2020-10-19 at 17.18.26.png|thumbnail! !Screen Shot 2020-10-19 at 17.18.37.png|thumbnail!

As a Next-gen project administrator, I would like to have the option to restrict existing issues, not only the next project issues created after setting the issue type restriction.

One good option would be to have the option that would allow the Next-gen project administrator to bulk edit those issues, bulk applying the issue type restrictions.

Currently, there is no workaround, issues created after the issue type restriction won't be affected by the issue type restrictions.
fields.summary: Next-gen projects - Allow set the issue type restriction to old existing issues.

fields.description:
h3. Summary

When creating an Issue in the Scope view of a Plan, Advanced Roadmaps doesn't use the *Issue create* Screen assigned to said Issue type since it uses its own function to create Issues into Jira which only requires the *Summary* field.

In situations where there mandatory fields, Advanced Roadmaps prompts you to fill in these mandatory fields and hides all optional fields.

 !2020-10-19_17-19-39.gif|width=400&height=200!

h3. Proposed solution

This can be problematic in scenarios where there's a lot of fields that need to be filled out during the creation process that are not mandatory which would normally be found in the *Create issue* Screen.

There should be an option to include the *Issue create* Screen from Jira in Plans when creating Issues or have a dedicated Screen function in Advanced Roadmaps to have a more unified experience when creating Issues from both sides.
fields.summary: Option to add a Create issue Screen to Plans

fields.description:
h3. Issue Summary
When setting up a plan, selecting the issue source, in the Scope pages, resolved issues are not shown in this page, but they are added to the plan. You cannot deselect them, not even using the 'deselect all' option.

If you click 'deselect all' and choose some issues, the resolved tickets are added to the plan along with the tickets you selected.

h3. Steps to Reproduce
# You have resolved tickets that you don't want in your plan
# These resolved tickets never show in the 'Scope' page, where you select/deselect the issues you want/don't want
# The issues are include by default, so when you hit 'deselect all' you're not actually deselecting these ones that were not included in the Scope page
# Because they were not deselected, they show in the Plan

h3. Expected Results
Only the selected issues at the Confirm what’s in scope should be included to the plan 

h3. Actual Results
Resolved tickets are still being added to the Plan

h3. Workaround
You can create a filter without these tickets and select it as issue source, rather than the project or  board.
fields.summary: Resolved tickets are not shown in Scope page and are still being added to the Plan

fields.description:
As a site-admin, the customer needs to export the list of all sprints to managing the entire site.
 For example, all sprints are shown in "Sprint" Field due to JSWCLOUD-10805, so It's natural for an admin to want to remove unnecessary sprints. For that, the list of sprints is important.
fields.summary: Export the list of all sprints

fields.description:
h3. Issue Summary

Quick Filters set on a board are being lost when navigating to a different page e.g Project Settings
h3. Steps to Reproduce
 # Set a Quick Filter on a board
 # Go to *Project Settings* and then click "*Back to the project*"
 # The board will be load with the *Quick Filter selected* (parameter in the URL &quickFilter=xx applied) but with all issues being loaded, not respecting the filter
 # After waiting for a few seconds, a pop-up will show up "This board has been updated: refresh" - where the filter will be applied if hit "*Refresh*".

h3. Expected Results

Board is loaded with the issues reflecting the filter set so the user doesn't have to deselect and select the quick filter again in order for it to be applied. 
h3. Actual Results

The filter is being shown as selected but the issues on the board are not reflecting the filter.
fields.summary: Quick Filters being lost when going away from the board

fields.description:
h3. Issue Summary

If we have only "*Development*" into "*Issue layout*" set as "*HIDE WHEN EMPTY*" the field will not appear on the New Jira Issue view, even if the field has information.
!image-2020-10-16-12-49-43-371.png|width=458,height=211!
h3. Steps to Reproduce
 # Open the issue layout.
 # Keep only "*Development*" under the section "*Hide when empty*".
 # Access an issue that has GitHub information.

h3. Expected Results
The Development field should appear on the right panel.
h3. Actual Results

When we have the field under "*Hide when empty*" the GET to retrieve the information will appear only after the "*Show more*" option. So, if we don't have another field, the "*Show more*" will not appear and the GET won't occur. For more information *[click here|https://share.getcloudapp.com/o0umevXk]*. 
h3. Workaround

Under Issue layout configuration, move the field from *Hide when empty* to *Context fields*.
fields.summary: If we have only "Development" into "Issue layout" set as "HIDE WHEN EMPTY" the field will not appear on the New Jira Issue view if only GitHub is integrated

fields.description:
h3.Summary

As per the summary, when creating issues from Advanced Roadmaps (after committing), the remaining estimate field should take the value of the original estimate if the remaining estimate field is left empty. Issues created from Portfolio will now just have the remaining estimate field empty.

If you create a JIRA issue, fill up the original estimate, and leave the remaining estimate blank, JIRA will automatically fill up the remaining estimate with the original estimate time value. 

For convenience, Advanced Roadmaps should behave the same as well.
fields.summary: When creating JIRA issue from Advanced Roadmaps, the remaining estimate field should take the value of the original estimate  if the remaining estimate field is empty

fields.description:
It would be useful if on the ticket layout the linked tickets were separated into two fields: Causes and Affects. It can be confusing that the causes is above a block or dependency. Humans natural read down the page and typically assume things will be in order.

Additionally, it would be nice if in Epic and Parent tickets to reorder the Jira tickets displayed and have that be "remembered." Even better would be if the dependencies forced specific orders although that may be more difficult.
fields.summary: Ticket Layout Updates for Links and Epics

fields.description:
h3. Issue Summary
Hovering over a relative dates in the detail dialog does not show absolute date

h3. Steps to Reproduce
 # View an issue which contains development or release information.
 # Open the development dialog to view data that has a relative date (e.g. Pull requests, Builds, Deployments)

h3. Expected Results
When hovering over the relative date, an absolute date should be shown.

h3. Actual Results
There is no tooltip on hover.

h3. Workaround

Click the link to view the entity in its native tool.
fields.summary: Hovering over a relative dates in the detail dialog does not show absolute date

fields.description:
Please fix the Epic burndown and release reports to make them respect time tracking settings.

Epic burndown and release reports do not consider the time tracking setting in classic board settings:
 !1.png|thumbnail!

Given an issue with an original time estimate and some time tracked against it:
   !2.png|thumbnail!

We can see this issue is correctly reflected in the sprint burndown report:
   !3.png|thumbnail!

But this is not reflected in the epic burndown report:
   !4.png|thumbnail!

Only once the issue is transitioned to *done* does it show up:
   !5.png|thumbnail!
fields.summary: Classic: Epic & Release burndown reports do not respect time tracking settings
